CatDescriptText: Maybelle Adams, R.D.1, Bridgeville, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is any racial tension in Pittsburgh? in neighborhood where you live?  If so, what do you think causes it?" answer reads: "I don't think that any racial tension exist here.  I think that everybody gets along all right regardless of race or religion.  There does not seem to be any tension either private or public, regardless of where the meeting between colored and white takes place."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Maybelle Adams wearing light colored blotch patterned short sleeved blouse and dark skirt, standing with arms crossed facing reporter holding notepad, on Wood Street with Raab Clothes and liberty Avenue with Dimlings Candy in background, Downtown
